content: The app itself seems fine, but limitations on the band itself mean that the end result is not useful as a reliable smart alarm. Mi Band Tools provides many of the "missing features" from the official Mi Fit app. One of those features is the Smart Alarm - which "tries to wake you up at the best time according to your empirical sleep patterns". Alas, I have found that the way this feature works, due to limitations on the band, is rather unreliable. I frequently find that the smart alarm does not fire at all, particularly if I haven't opened the Mi Band Tools app for a while. And an alarm that can't be relied upon to go off is not very useful, no matter how "smart" it might claim to be.

However, the reason for this 1 star feedback is because of the people behind it. Clearly they have no idea how social media work, and do not tolerate questions on their "posts" on twitter, to which they respond with sarcasm and blocking me! Too bad, the app is quite good, the widget quiet unique, but the people behind it have lost my vote of confidence. Uninstalling and forgetting it ever happened. Goodbye. So my results are random. Still, carry on innovating. Thanks." Where is it rude or insulting????
replyContent: Yes, we are blocking all rude and offensive Twitter users and we will keep doing that. We do not have to listen to insults from users who do not know how to behave. We'll let up to our users to make their own opinion about this "review". We want to improve our apps, not to spend our precious time dealing with users frustrated by their own lifes.

With this app the heart rate measurements are very inaccurate (in my tests ¬±25bpm). This is because it measures the time betwen two beats and calculates the beats per minute. The original Xiaomi app measures the time betwen 20 or more beats and averages the result which leads to much more accurate readings.
replyContent: The HR measurement is only as good as your hardware. We're not the manufacturer of the bracelet and therefore you are not reviewing our application.

content: The  description does not mention that it does not work WITHOUT Mi Fit. Having the "data collecting and cloud syncing app" Mi Fit installed is mandatory to run this app.  The description just says it "works very well with" and "you can always have" which means it should also be possible to have Mi Fit not installed.  Original description: This application works very well with original Mi Fit application (but is no way associated with Xiaomi). This means that you can always have the latest Mi Fit version and the latest Mi Band firmware in addition to great and powerful notification features.  A solution would be an option which allows to use the app without the Mi Fit installed (or uninstalled after the binding process) which will then disable some features. The only reason I purchased this app is the smart alarm.

The app is nice and can replace the Mi Fit app pretty good and adds some neat features. Best options are permanent heart rate tracking and sleep tracking in combination with sleep as android, the latter being my main reason for buying this app. Sleep tracking works pretty well and does not drain the battery too much. If you have set up alarms in the Mi Fit app, they won't show up in Tools & Mi Band, but using both apps at the same time works pretty well. For constant heart rate check and notifications, bluetooth needs to be active permanently. Reason for the 4 star rating is, because steps counting etc is not present, so you can't get rid of the Mi Fit app completely. Additionally the statistics and charts for heart rate could be better and more usable. If you have Sleep as Android installed and enabled wearables to use the band for sleep tracking, bluetooth might be activated by the apps automatically. That might be an issue if you are not planning to track your sleep or stay awake longer and want to save battery.

replyContent: Our professional outsourced customer support answered to this user very straightforwardly (and correctly) that he should use a VM(x) custom pattern to control vibration mode from plugins. Most features this app boasts come at the price of additional annoying vibrations. If you turn them off, it's not any better than Mi Fit (Sleep as Android integration aside, which was the reason I bought the app in the first place). Huge downside: it drains the band's battery when working with Mi Fit (it used to last 30+ days, after installing this app - barely10 days) and it doesn't want to work without Mi Fit. I don't think Sleep as Android integration is worth all the annoyances and the cost of this app.  EDIT: I would like to reiterate that it's not the phone's battery that is being drained, the app actually does very well in that area. It's the Mi Band's battery (the one with 70 mAh in specification and only 30 mAh as shown by my tester) that discharges 3 times as fast with this app.
replyContent: Sleep tracking with sensors on takes exactly 5% battery per night, which is absolutely normal and extremely small price for the advanced sleep tracking features you get with Sleep as Android integration. Also additional vibrations that you see during text display are technical limitation and is clearly explained directly inside of the application.

2 Mar 17 update:  No wonder after 3 MONTHS of issuing error logs this never got fixed. The developer has completely dismissed my review and 3 months of error logs I sent in the hope they would fix the issues.   What terrible awful customer service. DO NOT WASTE YOUR MONEY WITH THIS APP. If you end up like me, they don't care once you pay, they will never fix it, and will bad mouth you publicly on Google Play store when you are honest.   When I paid for this app, my review was 5 stars. I loved it and used it for more than a year. After waiting 3 months for the developer to fix the issues, I reluctantly went elsewhere.   Down graded from 2 stars to 1 start due to the very unprofessional actions by the developer.  2 Feb 17 update (did not display until 1 Mar 17 due to Google Play error):   Used to be fantastic, now terrible. Froze constantly and would either crash or take 10 minutes to be able to show anything.  I've reported the freezing and crashing for over 3 months, and updates did not resolve this. Tried re-installing/repairing/etc. and still no improvement.  It's disappointing as I really liked the app, but it just kills the phone now and there's no end in sight.
replyContent: So others can understand this intentional down-rate. This user changes his "review" statement almost every day, stating made up problems to do an intentional harm to this application. We'll let up to our users to make their own opinions about this. We want to improve our application and not spend our precious time dealing with users like this.

content: This app provides some useful features to give your mi band 2 a little more like a smart watch. However, it just kills battery life on your phone, not worth it.
replyContent: Measured battery consumption is 3% per 24 hours for 3000 mAh with 5 configured notifications each triggering 5 times per hour. This is already the technical minimum and is far from your stated "extreme" consumption. Please realize, before down-rating like this, that this application has to monitor every single notification in your system and react.

content: So a few issues since getting this update.  Now my mi band doesnt show up as a connected bluetooth device, so I cant use it for smart lock.  I'm guessing thats the firmware rather than this tool, but frustrating nonetheless.    Also I find it annoying that you get spammed with vibrations now, you get two vibrations with the icon of the notification, then a vibration for each segment of the text of the notification, so this can be aroudn 5 vibrations for one message.  However if someone then messages you or you get another notiication, it interrupts the half dispalyded notification and overrides it with the new one, so for all of these vibrations you dont even get to see the message. I'm already looking at hthe damn watch, I felt the initial double vibration why do I need a million vibrations while I'm looking ath the message or if I'm in the middle of something.  The other issue is that the long messages are a bit of a pain to read in this small text in such a small view area.  I get this isn't really your fault, but it's annoying and I'm considering turning off the text notifications again.  Someone sends me 2 short replies and it takes me narl 20 seconds to receive and read them.

Not a bad app, but it has a few downsides: 1. Band battery drain. The band loses roughly 4-5% of its charge per 24 hours, with just 3 apps set for notifications, incoming calls, sms and idle alert. With the official Mi Band app the drain is 1% per 24 hours, under the same conditions. 2. The MiBand 2 device is capable of displaying the caller name or number in the text field beneath the icon when used with the official app. Same for sms. This app doesn't support that feature. 3. No sleep tracking. Update for version 3.0.0: The band now displays caller names and even contents of text and whatsapp messages, but the battery drain on the band has gone up from the already high 3-4% in 24 hours to 6% in 24 hours and the app still does not support sleep tracking. Overall a nice update but needs more work.
replyContent: You're using old version of our application, please update to version 3.2.0 that brings hundreds of new fixes and features, including full text support and Sleep as Android integration on Mi Band 2 - see full changelog on http://help.mibandtools.com. We would be happy if you could afterwards appreciate our work by giving us better rating. Thank you

content: The app by itself is good enough - the most of the time I use it for continuous heart rate monitoring (with endomondo) and for different apps notifications. replyContent: Version 2.5.1 introduced custom vibration patterns usable from Tasker. Simple use VC(x,y,z) pattern. The heart rate is also controllable from Tasker using the HR() custom pattern.

content: Best
Any chance of implement shortcut to mute notification in plugin of tasker?
replyContent: You can already do that now - when notification is cleared from the Tasker, the vibration pattern on bracelet is stopped. So you can simply send clear notification signal from Tasker. Another option is sending screen off intent from the Tasker - does the same thing - dismisses notification. If you like our app, please reconsider your rating. Thanks

content: With the new update this turns out into a fine smartwatch!

I bought the app thinking that it would upgrade somehow my Mi Band 2. Whatever possessed me to think that a cheap fitness band should do things it is not intended to do is now beyond me. All that vibrating will consume battery life (and this is the strong point of this fitness band, so you are cancelling this point in fact). Setting target of e.g. 8000 steps in Mi Band is ignored if native app is set e.g. at 6.000 steps. Seeing caller number in row of three? why? By the time I have read the called id, the caller has hung up. It's quicker to whisk out the phone (and vibrating consumes battery life). So what's the point? It's a "A JE TO" application. Czechs know what it is and we used to have fun watching the cartoon. In real life it's less fun. My fault, I should have been forewarned. Did I mention that I approached the help site with an issue (was not in the FAQ section). Submitted everything they asked for. Did I get an answer? Nope. Don't bother with this app. Google Fit does the job nicely and is free.  But if you feel that you must control your music player from the Mi Band Tools, knock yourself out by all means.

replyContent: What are you talking about? content: I've been using this on rare occasions for 5 months and it still managed to fail me every time. D:
replyContent: Please make sure you are not using some kind of power saving applications (e.g. Doze), that could cause issues you are describing. Some android systems also have similar features integrated directly into the system settings. Also please make sure to turn any bluetooth power saving options off. Feel free to contact us if you need more help.

This app taps into some features that's not in the official Mi Fit app and adds more customization to those that's available. The pulse graph history and the ability to set intervals to check is pretty neat and setting different icons to app alerts are my favorite, but there's an essential feature that I feel is missing from this app, step history!  Sure it has a step count widget where you can place an icon outside of the app, but that just counts the current day. Where's my step-history?   In the official Mi Fit app, they have daily/weekly counts of your steps as well as average steps, down to the 'time' of your steps. Then a nice bar graph is shown. I wish this app would have all that so I don't need both apps. I feel without this function, it's not complete and feels like a 'supplement' (a nice one) to the official app.  Another feature on my wish-list is to incorporate friends' step-count. You know, anyone w/ this app we could friend each other and then be able to see each other's steps. This is great for friendly daily step-competition.  Despite the missing step-feature, I feel that this app is currently the best out there for the MiBand 2.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your rating :) Purpose of this application is to provide features that are not already available and functional in Mi Fit (eg. idle alerts, notification filters, hourly chimes, smart alarms, power naps, plugins, widgets). We believe that we achieved that goal of providing additional features (not available otherwise) pretty well :)

content: Nice app, but it drain MI band's battery  faster, than native app. There are 25% drained in a 2 days. MI Band 2
replyContent: Thanks for your rating. Measured battery consumption is 3% per 24 hours for 3000 mAh with 5 configured notifications each triggering 5 times per hour. This is already the technical minimum and is far from "extreme" consumption. Some tips for you - use less repeating, shorter patterns, etc. - this will help you get the most out of your battery.

content: For the dev: unfortunatly with the app running, the smart unlock is not operational otherwise great app, 5 stars when l Will be able to activate the smart lock

content: Great App
Worth every penny. It increases the functionality of the band and I would recomend it to anyone, if you use xiaomi bands, buy this app!

Great app adding missing features to orygina≈Ç Xiaomi Mi Fit app. 24H heartrate feature is one of them I bought it for. Please continue with new features integration. (Sleep monitoring, fitness tracking). Maybe one day you will be able to be great replacement for Mi Band and Google Fit ?

Works really well. Just for me on HTC ONE M8 the continued heart rate tracking doesnt work. Also if i set the tool to track heart rate on any frequency below 10 min it ignores it and tracks on every 10 min. I figured out that in the daily usage 10 min tracking is OK. I only miss it for the working out session where I need more readings in order to have more relevant data from my workout.  The readings from the band itself are not accurate enough, so if for 1 hour workout it is reading 6 times (every 10 min) the error is much bigger than if you have 60 readings (every 1 min ) and make an avarage.
Works perfectly
I'm looking for a total replacement for MI fit app.  This is an amazing replacement. 5 stars all the way but where's the sleep monitor?
Are you going to support Mi Band 2? I will love you forever and give you money.
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your support! Mi Band 2 is now fully supported! :) Mi Band Tools 2.0.0 introduced full Mi Band 2 support and it also contains several great features like multi-icon swapping. Please feel free to update to the latest version and enjoy! :)

content: No color notifications and custom notifications. Not satisfied for the money paid.
replyContent: There are several versions of Mi Band - versions 1A and 1S contains only white LEDs. It is of course technically not possible to display colors on hardware that has only white LEDs. My application auto-detects the version you are using and adjusts the user interface accordingly (you are also informed by in-app dialog what version you are using).

content: High quality, stable and good design. Waiting for the requested features :)
replyContent: Thanks for your rating and feature suggestion. I am constantly working on new features and improvements for my application. I do hope that I will deserve a 5* rating from you at some moment of time :)

content: This app gives good extra functionality over the official mi band app with heart rate monitoring and extra notification settings for vibrate. Doesn't effect battery life too much. Thanks.

I was really excited about the Smart Alarm feature and loved it for the first 2 weeks of using it. But one day I noticed that it had erased all of my settings - all my alarms, contact settings, and app notifications. I only noticed because my alarm didn't go off a few days in a row. Really cool app, but only useful if it's reliable.
replyContent: Your alarms settings is only deleted when you go to Mi Fit alarms configuration. As clearly stated within the explanation dialog of Mi Band Tools, you must remove any configured alarms from Mi Fit application PRIOR to setting them in Mi Band Tools and you can not open alarms settings in Mi Fit ever again. Please re-consider your rating.

content: I have used the app with all band versions and works great. Have had some trouble with content filters and more detailed notifications configuration, a little tutorial on this would be great.  One issue that I have noticed recently is the steps widget shows one value, usually higher than the Mi fit app shows, why is this?
replyContent: Thanks for your rating - if you want to get a guide for the filters, please go to the "More Information" screen for "Content Filters" or for "Duplicate Notification", we tried to put there hundreds of words to explain it as best as we could. You could also find easy guide on help.mibandtools.com. It might take a while for Mi Fit to sync the steps.

content: Great interface! The functionality that exist works perfectly this far. Only thing is that I would like to track exercises in same way as more advanced fitness applications/hardware does. Like "start exercise" and then continuously mapping steps vs heart rate. Tried to connect this app to Google Fit to get this option, but could not view the heart rate in Google fit, is it possible to do this? Would also be great to see the steps directly in Mi Band Tools, so you would not need the regular Mi Fit app.
replyContent: Thanks for your rating and feature suggestion. I am constantly working on new features and improvements for my application. I do hope that I will deserve a 5* rating from you at some moment of time :) Regarding Google Fit - it usually takes a while until Google Fit displays you the data in their application (e.g. 2 hours).

content: I can track my heart rate all day, every hour or every minute if I would. Appreciate this update very much. Thanks for your work.
Exactly what I needed. Is it possible to get a bigger widget please?
Great app. Worth this money ! With this app mi band is worth much more than ¬£9. Thanks !

The app is great, however notifications result in vibrations being repeated 8 times, even when they are set only to 1 time. Not sure what is causing that.. Edit: I did not change the vibration duration from the default, only the vibration number from 2 to 1. However, I will try again and change my rating if other settings fix it. Thank you for the swift reply though!
replyContent: Continuous vibrations longer than 500ms are not supported by Mi Band and it might feel like several vibrations in a row. Please use high delays to make this less evident. EDIT: try to set initial delay or you might also need to add exception for power-saving features in your phone, feel free to contact our support on the email if you need more help

content: Worked great until it didn't, emailed them for support twice and didn't get a response. EDIT: I responded to the email on 5/23. Instead of asking what the problem was, the dev decided to accuse me of not responding instead? He sure was quick to email me to complain about the review though!
replyContent: We responded to your email (sent to plikt15@gmail.com) 3 weeks ago (05/19/2016 at 17:10) and you never responded back to our support request where we asked for more info and your order number for pairing purposes. EDIT: we're not accusing you, we're simply stating the truth - you ignored our response and your ticket is still in pending state

content: Neviem preƒço ale id√∫ mi led len bielej farby
Really like the design and elegant simplicity of the app. Although functional is not complete. It will deserve 5-star rating with sleeping and steps sections added.
replyContent: Thanks for your rating. Purpose of this application is to provide features that are not already available and fully functional in Mi Fit (idle alerts, notification filters, hourly chimes, smart alarms, power naps, plugins, widgets, ...). We believe that we achieved that goal of providing additional features (not available otherwise) pretty well :)

content: 1) it would be cool if "notify on weekend" wouldn't be between Saturday 00:00 and Sunday 23:59 but Friday 20:00 and Sunday 20:00. I go late to bed on Friday, despite weekday, and earlier to bed on Sunday despite weekend. 2) it is the only background app on MIUI that i have that cannot keep its background daemon running despite miui allowing it. I have to lock it in RAM. Funny that an app designed for one kind of xiaomi hardware does not properly run on another kind of xiaomi hardware.
replyContent: 1) you can configure the notification times completely to your will - if you want multiple notification times that will not be in a row, you can simply duplicate the notification and set the times differently - it is completely under your control 2) that's completely normal, if you want, please read about Android services and how are they designed

content: I just got it yesterday, love all the different settings and "tools". replyContent: Please check an article about this on our knowledge base - help.mibandtools.com. We also recommend you to restart your mobile device to initialize your bluetooth correctly.

content: It is reliable and accurate.

You can find many guides how to do it for any application on the internet or please contact our support so we can help you to deserve that one extra star :) Thank you.

content: App works well and includes the ability for continuous time monitoring and customised vibration. The power nap alarm is also very handy.

replyContent: Thanks for your rating and feature suggestion. I am constantly working on new features and improvements for my application. I do hope that I will deserve a 5* rating from you at some moment of time :)

content: Could you implement sync to S health support?
replyContent: Thanks for your rating and feature suggestion. Since I am constantly working on new features and improvements for my application, you might see even this one coming in the future. I do hope that I will deserve a 5* rating from you at some moment of time.

content: Better at controling notifications than the original Mi app
I really like this app and the added functionality it provides to Mi Fit.  It's simple but very powerful.

Please simply restart your mobile device after an firmware or application update (as stated on the Google Play) and the heart rate interval measuring will be working absolutely correctly. We also highly recommend you to use only stable versions of Mi Fit from the Google Play store.

content: It's perfect!!!! The only thing that I noticed that wants fixing is that I have selected to get notifications from Viber and when they call me I answer the call and Mi Band keeps vibrating till I end the call. Other than that it's just perfect!!!! Bravo Developer for your great work!!!!

[UPDATE] To the developer, you don't seem to understand my criticism. After installing your app, the regular MiFit app couldn't properly sync with my band. So, it seems the interference was temporary.
replyContent: Thanks for your rating, please see our knowledge article about this if you need more help http://help.mibandtools.com/knowledge_base/topics/is-this-working-with-mi-fit. Thank you.

content: Need of development.Make a  option such that locked apps can be unlocked by Bluetooth service
replyContent: Thanks for your rating. If you have any feature suggestions, please send them to our support team, we would gladly discuss them with you to deserve a 5* :) Thank you.

content: This is a good app for getting more notification control with your Mi Band, but the heart rate monitoring is unreliable. Even when I'm not wearing the band it registers a heart rate. It needs to be able to detect when it isn't being worn.
replyContent: Thanks, but I would like to tell you that this is not technically possible for us to do. We are not manufacturers of the bracelet and the bracelet sends us the heart rate even when you put it off your hand. You would have to contact Xiaomi to resolve their own issue as we can not do anything about the optical heart rate sensor. Thank you.

content: Gives you more control over Mi Band for example continuous heart rate statistics are great!
Fully customise

Didn't recognize my band
replyContent: This application is able to connect to 100% of devices. Please follow detailed in-app guide how to proceed with pairing. Also make sure you're able to connect to your Mi Band using original Mi Fit. You can always easily do manual binding which works on 100% of devices and takes you about 20 seconds to enter Mi Band address manually.

content: Hey great app! Have a small question though. My phone died and I bought another one and this app is installed on both of them. So every morning I get a vibration as an alarm I set on the phone that died. Can I somehow delete the alarm bc it's irrelevant now.
replyContent: Thanks for your rating. You can delete the "old" alarms before reinstalling just by adding 3 new ("dummy") smart alarms and deleting then afterwards - this will force the old to get lost from the bracelet's memory and you can configure only those you are interested in afterwards.

content: Great app if you want continuous heart rate measurement and high/low rate notifications. Non-default vibrations for notifications also work correctly. Note: band battery lasts only 2 days when continuous heart rate measurement is enabled.
Has all the features I need from overbloated stock app + much more

How can I display the CSV file produced on my Desktop computer?  The file opens in Excel.  Commas separate: dateTime, rate, rate zone.  Perhaps I am missing a trick.  I want to be able to have a graph of dateTime v. rate and rate zone.  Also I would like to see my heart rate on Google Fit.
replyContent: Thanks for your rating, you can simply enable heart rate sync into the Google Fit if you go to Heart Rate - Settings and you enable Google Fit synchronization (please see help.mibandtools.com). In excel, you can chose CSV separators during the opening of the CSV file.

content: This app works very well and has a very intuitive interface. Make sure you turn notification access off from the original Mi App. The team responds to queries very quickly. Worth the purchase.
Worth it

Works great. Take great care sorting out your phones settings so that the app isn't killed in the background as this can cause issues! It's nice to have the early bird alarm which disappeared from the original xiaomi app!! The developer replied quickly and provided good assistance to issues.
replyContent: Thanks for your review Harry. I would like to appeal on everyone else having issues - feel free to send an support email to info@mibandtools.com prior to giving bad reviews, this application really works with 100% of devices once the system is configured correctly and we will be glad to help you with the configuration to deserve a good rating.

content: This app is a must have if you own any of the Xiaomi's MiBands. Connection is a bit fidgy from time to time but thats only because of the MiBands ultra low power consuption hardware.

I'm pretty much waiting for other features: step and sleep-quality charts; they're surely missing. (right now it only has heart rate chart). And colorful UI & charts would be awesome. I am pretty sure there is something incorrect in your configuration - basically the repeating mode is calculated from the initial time you set (first line) and it adds minutes to the notify from time you set below it. If you need help, feel free to send us an email and we can look into it :)

content: The features are good, but maybe some improvements can be implemented, like mi band battery level and also more graphics user interface for apps notification filter. I still can't block group notification without going to the group and mute them directly.
replyContent: Please follow the detailed in-app guide that describes very precisely how you can mute concrete groups (Content Filters - More Info) or follow our guide on help.mibandtools.com. You can add battery level as a widget to your home screen or you can find it directly as a toolbar icon in the settings of this application.

content: Can you please give more options for notification in whatapp contacts, so that one can get notified for certain whatapp contacts , not all
replyContent: Thanks for your rating. This is already fully supported by Mi Band Tools. Please go to Content Filter and tap on More Info or go to Duplicate Notification and tap on More Info - there is an very detailed in-app description how to use this feature. You can also find an guide on our knowledge base help.mibandtools.com. Thank you.

content: As the title said, the best Mi Band app. This app transform the Mi Band from a very basic fitness band to a band which you can include in your everyday life activities. Great job on this app overall, don't stop improving!!

The application is a nice addition, has a lot of space for improvement. The thing that bothers me so far is a continuous ask for a permission to get notifications. I could not find a way to disable it. Could you please add this functionality? Basically, these continuous ask for the notification area permission does not follow Google's standard.
replyContent: Please simply add the notification access for Mi Band Tools (or follow the guide that Mi Band Tools offers you inside of this dialog). The notification access is crucial for this (and all similar) applications, it is simply how Android works - you have to give application access so it can - well - access notifications in your system and react.

content: How about add something clear the heart rate history. Overall it is a great app worth the money.

it runs perfectly for all its specifications and it really deserves 5 stars. however,  I would recommend to add also the functions that you can find it only in original application(steps graphics,  sleep analysis and sync with google fit) because the xiaomi mi fit is very battery hunger. now i have to keep both application for all synchronizations. content: Well-built!

content: The sync of heart rate works only when the app is open. Once I close it, it stops reading my heart rate. I have given it access permissions.

content: Adds some really useful functionality to the Mi band.
He explains details of my problems with great patient. Thanks again

content: Gr8 app, love the consistent new versions, each one brings new possibilities! Hope you can manage convince sleep4android to add support for it!

content: Can you detect and stop hr while charging automatically. And could add play sound option for sleep assistance?  You can find music in many sleep assistance app. Anw, this is a great app. Thank you for your support.

content: Great App!

Given the universally positive reviews for this app and the poor ones for Mi Band Notify & Fitness, I downloaded and paid for its pro version immediately, not even bothering to check out the other one. Unfortunately, at least on my phone, this app has been utterly unreliable. It keeps disconnecting from the Mi Band and I miss important notifications because of it. replyContent: Your only email was: "Do I have to disable Aggressive Doze in Greenify? Thanks for making this wonderful app. It‚Äôs so much better than Mi Fit, it‚Äôs not even funny." and our immediate response was: "Yes, otherwise your system will kill our application." content: I did bought Mi Band this evening, then I realize that Mi Fit is full of serveral bug and lack the most of necessary Mi Band's control. Your app did save my life man. Keep up the good work and Thx again for making this app :)

content: You need to optimize the battery use, or make some interruptions for the continuous usage of the application which are linked to send notification to the MiBand. My Phone drains two times faster with this app installed. I also uninstall it, and I'm waiting for a solution. Thank you!
replyContent: Measured battery consumption is 3% per 24 hours for 3000 mAh with 5 configured notifications each triggering 5 times per hour. This is already on the technical minimum and absolutely great for features provided. Please realize that this application has to monitor every single notification in your system and react.

content: One of the best applications for mi band to get more out of it‚Ä¶ just like rooting a phone.  Heart monitoring fails sometimes when trying to measure manually. content: Great Material Design. Cool functions. I just would like to ask, why smart alert when set from this app is kind of shorter and lighter and is not repeating.  If the same alert is set from miband app it is OK.

Nice features and lots more control over the Mi.  Disappointed that there are no graphs/charts that I found for steps or sleeping.  I was in hopes that this would replace the MiFit app, but There are only widgets for steps, graphs are needed. content: Is it necessary to keep bluetooth on to make the Idle Alert work?

replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review! :) Sadly the bracelet does not support broadcasting the tapping action back to the phone, so it is not really possible, but there is a workaround to do this - the bracelet can dismiss a single long vibration by tapping it, so if you set 1 vibration of 10.000ms without repeating, you will be able to dismiss it by tap.

I'm not saying no :) but they have currently lower priority since they are in Mi Fit.

content: This app does exactly what the new miband app claims to do but doesn't... IT WORKS! Notifications work well. Worth every cent.

One of the coolest apps in play store! This app allows you to do insanely cool things with your Mi Band, things that are not at all possible with any other app inluding the original Xiaomi Mi Fit. Other apps offer little or limited functionality while this one allows you to customize and configure anything that you desire. You can set a custom RGB color (full palette) for any app or any person who contacts you via some app. You can also set a custom vibration pattern or repeated vibrations/blinks with customizable number of repeats. For any notification you can set a time period when its enabled, disable it when screen is off, etc. There's a multitude of options and the possibilities are endless. The most powerful feature is adding keywords to look for in notifications (Android ticker text) with optional regex syntax. This allows you to set different notifications depending on the keywords contained in the notification text in the status bar. Combine this with Tasker or similar app and you can get a notification for any possible event raised in the Android system. The developer is very active and helpful. If you have a Mi Band look no further. Buy this app!
A fantastic app, with so many options. Thank you üëç

Aside of the original mi fit app, this one is the most reliable for app/call/sms notification and alarm. the only feature I miss and really wish to find soon in this app is an anti-loss alarm. But in the end, mi band tools really deserves its 5 stars and is a must have for mi band ownersüòä
replyContent: Thanks a lot for your review, I can reveal to you that anti-loss feature is already in beta testing, so you should be able to see it soon :)

replyContent: Thanks for your review. Mi Band firmware (bluetooth protocol) sadly does not support lighting of separate LEDs so it is not technically not possible to light LEDs separately.You can turn on all (default vibration) or middle (non-default vibration) or nothing.

Both - Mi Band Tools and Mi Band uses bluetooth low energy protocol (BLE) and that's why it's battery consumption is negligible.

replyContent: Thanks for your review! :) It is very straightforward: 1) create an application notification and set content filter for it 2) tap "Duplicate Notification" (filters section) and choose another content filter for the same application or leave it empty so it works as an fallback without filters 3) set different colors etc. for the duplication

Even though I've kept only 2 vibrations per notification, sometimes it's vibrating 10 times. Very irritating. Please resolve this. Edit : gave that downgraded rating just to get your attention.
replyContent: This is not a bug, it's a hardware (Mi Band) related limitation. Set initial delay to let's say 5s (or experiment with value that suits your device), it will get better as it gives the Mi Band some time to re-establish the connection. EDIT: in case your hardware has these issues, use dafault vibration pattern of MBT (it's not affected by latency)

content: By far, the best one. Plus it is improving on each update. Alarm is awesome. Great job
Great application! Thank you for your work! Could you, please add possibility to decline incoming calls by knocking on the band? It could be awesome feature!
Great app, only little issue is that sometimes when I receive a notification it won't stop vibrating unless I shake the band. That could be just the way I set up the profile.
Love it
Notification works extremely well.  No major issues.  I am getting "Vibrating: Incoming call" when alarm is triggered.  Any idea why?  I disable alarm from the Mi Band app.
replyContent: Thanks for your rewiew. Alarm feature already has weekday and weekends option :) In fact it has completely configurable days - just select Days repeat mode. EDIT: default repeating alarm pattern is same as the one for incoming calls, just change it to whatever you like, you can set any color and any vibration pattern for alarms.

Seriously, I never review apps but this is amazing.
Amazing number of features, hard working developer.
Hi Dev.. Could u help me to set up this app because it's say that my app license is a copy of piracy.. Was bought this once then refund it then I'll buy it again but still it's say piracy..
replyContent: We're really sorry, but this is problem with Google Licensing Servers we sadly can not do anything about. It's not really our fault and Google must fix their servers - many developers lately have these issues and we're sadly absolutely powerless. For more information, please visit http://help.mibandtools.com/knowledge_base/topics/invalid-license

content: Overall good but there is a serious bug that needs to be fixed ASAP. I have my notifications set to 1 vibration, however for my email apps (Inbox) if I get an email and don't check it, the next email to come in would initiate 10 vibrations instead of 1 and it happens for each notification after that as well. Please fix it as this will affect the battery life majorly.
replyContent: First vibration after some time might be off unless you set up initial delay - this is hardware (Mi Band) related limitation. Please either stick to default vibration patterns or set initial delay to let's say 5s (or experiment with value that suits your device), it should get better as it gives the Mi Band some time to re-establish the connection.

content: This app is great! I'm able to set important notices to go to my Mi Band. I had some trouble that ended up being entirely my fault, but the developer responded quickly to give helpful feedback.
Emailed about help with content filters and Zdenek was VERY helpful.

Reliable connection! Getting all notifications consistently. However the multiple notifications filter doesn't seem to work. I've set 10 seconds to ignore notifications for WhatsApp but I'm still getting vibration on my band for every message.
replyContent: Thanks for your review. I just checked multiple notification filter and it is working as expected. Please make sure to set this option on every application notification instance (duplicate). If you want, feel free to export your settings and send it to my email and I will help you and tell you what to set or what's going on.

content: I am 100% positive that I was getting short vibrations (50ms) when I first installed mi tools. It was actually still with tweaked version of mi band app. Anyway now, no matter I do I get 500ms. 200ms is as long as 500ms too.
replyContent: Non-default vibrations are not supported by Mi Band and vibration lengths might be off if you use them. This is not a bug, but hardware limitation of some devices. Setting Initial Delay to 5s or more might help. You can also use default vibration (2x for 500ms with 200ms delay) to prevent it. Please do not down-rate because of hardware limitations.

content: For some reason every time I get a notification, the middle LED will first light up blue, and then all three LEDs will change into the set color and flash accordingly. Also, occasionally a notification will vibrate 7 times even though I only set it to 1 or 2. This mostly happens with snapchat, but also FB messenger a few times I think.
replyContent: Thanks for your review. Regarding middle blue LED - this is not a bug, it is completely normal to have middle LED in blue while using non-default vibrations, this is how Mi Band hardware and firmware works. If you don't like this, you have to use default vibration of Mi Band (2x 500ms with 200ms delay) as these does not have this short indication.

content: Excellent application, developer responds very quickly to questions and provides a service that is unheard of for apps. I think the app is easy to use, has great functionality and would give it 5 stars. Learning more and more but awesome application and would recommend it to anyone who bought a Mi Band! Takes the band to the next level without the high price tag.
Very very loved this app, thank you!
I made mistake by giving 1 star to this app first...  But now this app deserves 5 star

content: Thanks for clearing my doubts. The most admirable thing about this app is the developer responds quickly to every comment for that i give 5 stars!!
replyContent: Thanks for your review. This is not a bug - alarm clock notification is non-clearable notification. This means that this notification can not be cleared by the user and the state that you dismissed the notification is never broadcasted to other applications. I recommend using Mi Fit application for alarms because it is hardware (sleep cycle) based.

content: This app so far in my testing does not work with the clock app. I set the band to vibrate on clock notification but it's not going off. Goes off during the internal testing within the app though. Dev is also rude and up helpful. Will be requesting refund through Google.

content: It works perfectly, very useful, although since installation and setup I experience more frequent Smart Lock lock-outs than before (so Lollipop Smart Lock stops working and I have to enter my PIN again instead of being unlocked automatically -- it seems related to some cases when a notification has arrived and Mi Band gets notified also -- NOTE: this issue has also been present before installing this app, but now seems being more frequent).

I don't know where the problem is. Can you assist me about my problem? I already enable access on notification. Sometimes it works, but mostly my notifications can't show on my band. Have other suggestions?
replyContent: You either did not enabled notification access or you have set up the conditional settings incorrectly (e.g. incorrect time conditions, content filters, disable while screen on, ...). If you need further help, contact me using my email (please attach screenshot of your notification settings) so I can help you.

content: This app brings a whole new level of usefulness to my Mi Band. It has a lot of great features, but lacks a battery level indicator. While that is a feature of Mi Fit, it'd be useful to have it here. A widget that shows remaining battery life would be even better. Overall, it's a great product. Good job!
replyContent: Thanks for your review! :) I just pushed new version that contains fully customizable widgets! You can have one (or more) nice looking widget that contains every useful information you might need: daily steps, daily steps goal percentage, battery percentage. You can configure all colors, backgrounds, transparency, ... :) give it a go.

content: The best companion app for mi band ever! Please don't downrate this app. I can see users fretting over a hypothetical missing alarm feature. content: Hi. There is an issue with the sign in process in Mi Fit, which impedes setting up Mi Band. Apparently other users had have this issue, but it wasn't be solved yet by Xaomi's team. Is it possible to configure the bracelet without using Mi Fit app? Regards, Santiago
replyContent: Yes, Mi Band Tools is working without Mi Fit installed. Please follow detailed in-app guide how to proceed with pairing. You can do manual binding which works on 100% of devices and takes you about 20 seconds. You can uninstall Mi Fit after pairing, but this application is not intended as Mi Fit replacement and it is better to use them together.

content: Apart from maintaining a constant connection. App works flawlessly

This app is a step forward in wearable technology. It provides some very useful features that are not available on the Mi Fit app. Not only can you get the band to alert you for calls and application messages, but you can configure each alert so that you know what it is without even looking at your phone. Highly recomended for every Mi Band owner. The developer also provides excellent support.
Good xiaomi

Great developer who is open to suggestions and is very capable of putting out a great app. All of the available features are great and so much better than the Tweaked Mi Fit app. I like the new vibration pattern menus and would love to see a similar one for the LEDs (time in between flashes, etc.) I still get more connection issues than I'd like. The resolution issue with the color sliders still haven't been fixed but I'm sure you'll get to it eventually!
replyContent: Thanks for kind review! I just released new version that simplifies LED configuration (count, length, delay) + some more options regarding pattern repetitions (repeat only LEDs, only vibrations, everything). Connection stability should also improve.

content: Thank you very much, best $1 I've ever spent!

This developer is a genious. Forget MI Band Notify PRO & Mi Band Notifier. This tool here has it all: Proper BT connection with your band, Dismiss/Snooze by shaking, Take a nap mode, Custom contacts or App notification, Custom vibration pattern. -- If the developer can create an interface to record the custom vibration pattern by tapping on the screen, that automatically records the pattern and sleep times, then allow the user to choose the color pattern, that would be more intuitive than writing commands manually V(*) C(100,50,255)
replyContent: Thanks for your kind review. You can use "Insert" button to insert commands into your custom pattern builder. This will help you create custom patterns and also it can offer you color selector dialog for C(R, G, B) command. I'm currently working on more intuitive custom pattern builder, stay tuned.
